sentences.english: We were still at the legation at Eaton Place.

sentences.chinese: 当时，日本在北平已设有公使馆。

definition: Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
consul
the Qing dynasty equivalent of the Foreign Office
a street to the south of the Forbidden City that was the Legation quarter during the Boxer uprising
Klemens Freiherr von Ketteler, German minister killed during the Boxer uprising
Tang Shaoyi (1862-1939), politician and diplomat
consulate
foreign concession, an enclave occupied by a foreign power (in China in the 19th and 20th centuries)
Lu Zhengxiang (1871-1949), Chinese diplomat and Catholic monk
minister/diplomat performing ambassadorial role in Qing times, before regular diplomatic relations
Sir Thomas Francis Wade (1818-1895), British diplomat and sinologist, originator of the Wade-Giles Chinese romanization system
stationed in China/located in China
Wu Tingfang (1842-1922), diplomat and lawyer

James Bruce, 8th Earl of Elgin (1811-1863), British High Commissioner to China who ordered the looting and destruction of the Old Winter Palace Yuanmingyuan 圓明園|圆明园 in 1860/Thomas Bruce, 7th Earl of Elgin (1766-1841), who stole the Parthenon Marbles in 1801-1810
Eight-Nation Alliance, involved in a military intervention in northern China in 1900
the Warlord government of Northern China that developed from the Qing Beiyang army 北洋軍閥|北洋军阀 after the Xinhai revolution of 1911
